docs.lead_paragraph: The Vesta Insurance Group said here today that it was conducting an internal investigation into accounting irregularities and that its president and chief executive had resigned. The irregularities are expected to reduce earnings reported for the last two quarters by an estimated $15.25 million, Vesta said.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''In Health Care, Be Careful What You Wish For'' (Week in Review, May 31) rightly warns that a bill of rights for patients will only exacerbate their anger and frustration with health maintenance organizations. You tell us that more H.M.O. accountability means more micro-management of care by nonphysicians, less choice of physician and the possible end of traditional fee-for-service health insurance altogether. Unstated is that there would be no bill of rights for the 41 million Americans with no health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. George E. Pataki returned to his hometown today to kiss his mother, shake dozens of sweaty hands, recite his accomplishments and formally announce his campaign for re-election. It was a euphoric moment for Mr. Pataki, who was largely unknown and struggled to be taken seriously when he emerged four years ago as the Republican challenger to Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, a Democrat of national stature seeking his fourth term.

headline.main: With a Hometown Embrace, Pataki Begins His Campaign

docs.abstract: New York State Gov George E Pataki returns to his hometown of Peekskill, NY, to shake dozens of hands, recite his accomplishments and formally announce his campaign for re-election; scene described; photo (M)
